Submodules¶

lung_cancer.models.metrics module¶

Contain different metrics functions.

lung_cancer.models.metrics.accuracy(y_true, y_pred, threshold=0.5)[source]¶

Compute accuracy on input batched y_pred and y_true.

Parameters:
  • y_true (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing true target values.
  • y_pred (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing predictions of model.
  • threshold (float) – threshold for mapping probabilities into class.
Returns:

accuracy metric value.
Return type:

float
lung_cancer.models.metrics.dice(y_true, y_pred, epsilon=1e-06)[source]¶

Compute Dice coefficient.

Parameters:
  • y_true (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing true target values.
  • y_pred (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing predictions of model.
Returns:

dice coefficient.
Return type:

float

Get number of False Negative values.

  • y_pred (ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing predictions of model.
  • threshold (float) – threshold for mapping probabilities into class.

False negative rate.

Parameters:
  • y_true (ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing true target values.
  • y_pred (ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing predictions of model.
  • threshold (float) – threshold for mapping probabilities into class.
  • epsilon (float) – small real valu for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

false negative rate value.

float

lung_cancer.models.metrics.sym_dice(y_true, y_pred, alpha, epsilon=1e-06)[source]¶

Symmetric dice coefficient.

Parameters:
  • y_true (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing true target values.
  • y_pred (np.ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array containing predictions of model.
  • alpha (float) – weight of dice coeffecient computed by ‘1’ class labels.
  • epsilon (float) – small real value for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

symetrized by ‘0-1’ class labels dice coefficient.
Return type:

float

lung_cancer.models.utils module¶

Different useful functions when working with models and CTImagesMaskedBatch.

lung_cancer.models.utils.nodules_info_to_rzyx(nodules, scale=True)[source]¶

Transform data contained in nodules_info array to rzyx format.

lung_cancer.models.utils.nodules_sets_overlap_jit[source]¶

Compute overlap matrix for two sets of nodules.

Parameters:
  • nodules_true (ndarray(l, 4)) – numpy array containing info about centers of target nodules and theirs diameters.
  • nodules_pred (ndarray(k, 4)) – numpy array containing info about centers of predicted nodules and theirs diameters;
Returns:

overlap matrix for two sets of nodules.
Return type:

ndarray(l, k)
lung_cancer.models.utils.overlap_true_pred_nodules(batch)[source]¶

Accumulate info about overlap between true and predicted nodules in pipeline vars.

lung_cancer.models.utils.sphere_overlap[source]¶

Two nodules overlap volume normalized by total volume of second one.

Parameters:
  • nodule_true (ndarray) – numpy array with information about true nodule: nodule_true[1:] - [z,y,x] coordinates of true nodule’s center, nodule_true[0] - radius of true nodule.
  • nodule_pred (ndarray) – numpy array with information about predicted nodule: nodule_pred[1:] - [z,y,x] coordinates of predicted nodule’s center, nodule_pred[0] - radius of predicted nodule;
Returns:

overlap volume divided by sum of input nodules’ volumes.
Return type:

float
lung_cancer.models.utils.test_on_dataset(batch, model_name, unpacker, batch_size, period, **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute metrics of model on dataset.

Parameters:
  • model_name (str) – name of model.
  • unpacker (callable) – function that will be used for unpacking data from test_pipeline batches.
  • batch_size (int) – size of batch when making predictions.
  • period (int) – frequency of test_on_dataset runs.
  • kwargs (dict) – these parameters will be fed into unpacker function after batch and model arguments.
Returns:

unchanged input batch.
Return type:

CTImagesMaskedBatch
lung_cancer.models.utils.unpack_clf(batch, model, threshold=10, dim_ordering='channels_last')[source]¶

Unpack data from batch in format suitable for classification task.

Parameters:
  • batch (CTImagesMaskedBatch) – batch to unpack.
  • model (dataset.models.BaseModel) – model where the data from batch will be fed. Is not used here. Required for compatibility with dataset.Pipeline.train_model and dataset.Pipeline.predict_model interface.
  • threshold (int) – minimum number of ‘1’ pixels in mask to consider it cancerous.
  • dim_ordering (str) – can be ‘channels_last’ or ‘channels_first’. Reflects where to put channels dimension: right after batch dimension or after all spatial axes.
  • Returns –
  • dict (-) – {‘x’: images_array, ‘y’: labels_array}

Note

‘dim_ordering’ argument reflects where to put ‘1’ for channels dimension.

lung_cancer.models.utils.unpack_component(batch, model=None, component='images', dim_ordering='channels_last')[source]¶

Basic way for unpacking ‘images’ or ‘masks’ from batch.

Parameters:
  • batch (CTImagesMaskedBatch) – batch to unpack.
  • model (dataset.models.BaseModel) – model where the data from batch will be fed. Is not used here. Required for compatibility with dataset.Pipeline.train_model and dataset.Pipeline.predict_model interfaces.
  • component (str) – component to unpack, can be ‘images’ or ‘masks’.
  • dim_ordering (str) – can be ‘channels_last’ or ‘channels_first’. Reflects where to put channels dimension: right after batch dimension or after all spatial axes.
Returns:

unpacked ‘images’ or ‘masks’ component of batch as numpy array.
Return type:

ndarray(batch_size, zdim, ydim, xdim, 1)
Raises:

AttributeError – if argument component is not ‘images’ or ‘masks’.
lung_cancer.models.utils.unpack_reg(batch, model, threshold=10, dim_ordering='channels_last')[source]¶

Unpack data from batch in format suitable for regression task.

Parameters:
  • batch (CTImagesMaskedBatch) – batch to unpack
  • model (dataset.models.BaseModel) – model where the data from batch will be fed. Is not used here. Required for compatibility with dataset.Pipeline.train_model and dataset.Pipeline.predict_model interface.
  • threshold (int) – minimum number of ‘1’ pixels in mask to consider it cancerous.
  • Returns –
  • dict – {‘x’: images_array, ‘y’: y_regression_array}

Note

‘dim_ordering’ argument reflects where to put ‘1’ for channels dimension.

TODO Need more testing.

lung_cancer.models.utils.unpack_seg(batch, model=None, dim_ordering='channels_last')[source]¶

Unpack data from batch in format suitable for segmentation task.

Parameters:
  • self (CTImagesMaskedBatch) – batch to unpack.
  • model (dataset.models.BaseModel) – model where the data from batch will be fed. Is not used here. Required for compatibility with dataset.Pipeline.train_model and dataset.Pipeline.predict_model interfaces.
  • dim_ordering (str) – can be ‘channels_last’ or ‘channels_first’. Reflects where to put channels dimension: right after batch dimension or after all spatial axes.
  • Returns –
  • dict – {‘x’: images_array, ‘y’: labels_array}

Note

‘dim_ordering’ argument reflects where to put ‘1’ for channels dimension both for images and masks.

Module contents¶

Module of nn-models for classification/segmentation of lung-cancer on CT-scans.
